name: df-fl
body: |- wceq(cfl, cmpt(s0, cr, crio(s1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), clt, co(cv(s1), caddc, nat1))))))
comment: Define the floor (greatest integer less than or equal to) function. See ~ flval for its value, ~ fllelt for its basic property, and ~ flcl for its closure. For example, ` ( |_ `` ( 3 / 2 ) ) = 1 ` while ` ( |_ `` -u ( 3 / 2 ) ) = -u 2 ` ( ~ ex-fl ). The term "floor" was coined by Ken Iverson. He also invented a mathematical notation for floor, consisting of an L-shaped left bracket and its reflection as a right bracket. In APL, the left-bracket alone is used, and we borrow this idea. (Thanks to Paul Chapman for this information.) (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2004.)
